paper_abstract: Let L be a sparse context-free language over an alphabet of t letters and let f(L) : N-t -> N be its Parikh counting function. We prove the following two results: 1. There exists a partition of N-t into a finite family of polyhedra such that the function f(L) is a quasi-polynomial on each polyhedron of the partition. 2. There exists a partition of N-t into a finite family of rational subsets such that the function f(L) is a polynomial on each set of the partition. (C) 2009 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: The Parikh counting functions of sparse context-free languages are quasi-polynomials
